trial_identification.studytitle: Trauma Reception and Resuscitation Project - Time for a new approach
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A randomised controlled trial comparing trauma resuscitation supported by real time computer prompted algorithms against those without.

interventions.interventions: Trauma resuscitation supported by real time, computer prompted algorithms. 9 month period of data collection during the intervention period.
interventions.comparator: An historical control collected prior to the intervention period to assess for the Hawthorne effect. Participants will receive trauma resuscitation not supported by real time, computer prompted algorithms. 9 month period of data collection during the intervention period.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Data will be collected progressively throughout the nine months of video data collection and will be measured at the time of auditing.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: 1) Standardising, publishing and distributing resuscitation documentation, interventions and diagnoses.
2) Critical evaluation of the cost-benefit of trauma resuscitation video audit.
3) Rejuvenation of resuscitation research through the development of a standardised environment.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: 1162 test and control trauma cases presenting to the Trauma Centre of the Alfred Hospital. Stable trauma patients (ie pulse rate <100 bpm, MAP >70 mmHg, Hb >70, temperature > 35 and < 37.5, SpO2 > 92%, GCS >13).
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Undergoing the secondary transfer from another hospital, where trauma occurred > 6hrs prior to arrival, will be excluded.

trial_design.sequence: Trauma patients will be allocated to a trauma bay on their arrival. This will be in sequence from T1 - T4. Two bays have the computer sysytem and two do not.

contact.name: Mr Nathan Farrow
contact.address: The Alfred Hospital Bayside Health PO Box 315 Prahran VIC 3181

contact.name: Associate Professor Mark Fitzgerald
